sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt powder) - Online suppliers or metal supply stores; P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical supply companies; Sm (Samarium powder) - Specialty metal suppliers; V (Vanadium powder) - Metal alloy suppliers; Y (Yttrium powder) - Rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder) - Online suppliers or metal supply stores; P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical supply companies; Sm (Samarium powder) - Specialty metal suppliers; V (Vanadium powder) - Metal alloy suppliers; Y (Yttrium powder) - Rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Measure each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, add the cobalt powder first. 3. Gradually add the phosphorus powder while stirring continuously with a spatula to ensure an even mix. 4. Add the samarium powder, followed by vanadium and yttrium powders, ensuring uniform distribution. 5. Continue mixing until the powder blend is homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, add the cobalt powder first. 3. Gradually add the phosphorus powder while stirring continuously with a spatula to ensure an even mix. 4. Add the samarium powder, followed by vanadium and yttrium powders, ensuring uniform distribution. 5. Continue mixing until the powder blend is homogeneous.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a graphite crucible. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Transfer the mixed powder into a graphite crucible. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and alloy formation.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled down to avoid thermal shock to the crucible.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled down to avoid thermal shock to the crucible.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Extract the solidified material and inspect for any irregularities. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear coat to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Extract the solidified material and inspect for any irregularities. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear coat to enhance durability.
